meanings.definition: A male bird, especially a rooster.
meanings.sent1: The colorful cowks crowed loudly at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The farm had many cowks strutting around the yard.
meanings.sent3: The cowks had a meeting to discuss the early wake-up calls.
meanings.sent4: His voice was as proud as a cowks announcing the sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The cowks' feathers shimmered in the sunlight, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To move or walk in a slow, unsteady manner.
meanings.sent1: She cowksed along the path, taking in the scenery.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker cowksed up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to cowks gracefully on the ice but slipped comically.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to cowks forward as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The old man cowksed through the park, enjoying the fresh air.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp pain or ache.
meanings.sent1: He winced in pain as a sharp cowks shot through his leg.
meanings.sent2: The athlete felt a cowks in his side during the race.
meanings.sent3: The cowks in her tooth made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The news hit him like a cowks to the heart.
meanings.sent5: The sudden cowks in her back made her gasp in discomfort.
